creditline: The William Hood Dunwoody Fund and Gift of funds from Louis W. Hill, Jr.
description: unsigned; from the Saga Palace, Kyoto; two figures on a walkway between ponds
medium: Sliding door; ink, light color, and gold on paper
text: These twelve sliding panels are part of a set of sixteen that originally formed the four walls of a small reception chamber in Saga Palace (now destroyed) in northwest Kyoto. Representing the various activities associated with rice cultivation, the panel
title: Rice Farming in the Four Seasons, Summer [center right]
